p: Heavy metals such as mercury, cadmium, lead, and arsenic pose a threat to human health causing several adverse effects on a number of organs [ 50]. Seafood consumption is one of the main routes of exposure to heavy metals that accumulate in fish tissues and this could jeopardize its benefits. The metal amount in seafood does not necessarily pose a significant health risk and consuming a diversity of fish could limit potential harms, nonetheless, care must be taken when dealing with fish derivatives to avoid their concentration in the final product.
